dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Vance -- you're a psychiatrist and a biochemist, isn't that right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.  I've long believed that in order to achieve true health, we have to reconcile the body and the mind.  Of course that also requires letting go of a lot of our old notions and superstitions, which is what my work is all about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's talk about that.  How do you account for the fascination with things that go bump in the night?  Movies, books, videogames -- seems like we can't get enough of our boogeymen?

dialogue.raw_text: Monsters provide a means for us to transfer our more primal and darker urges into something external.  In the case of vampires, you're dealing with taboo issues like predatory rage and sexual sadism. These are scary subjects for people to own up to.

dialogue.raw_text: So we pass the buck to someone else?

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly.  Historically, people suffering from medical conditions have always been our psychological scapegoats.  In the Middle Ages schizophrenia was often attributed to demonic possession.

result.heading: AT THE BACK OF THE ATRIUM

direction.raw_text: ON Blade's face, his body being wheeled on an autopsy gurney.  PULL BACK to reveal that we are in an FBI morgue. Cumberland and Hale stand nearby, overseeing everything as -- A TRIO OF MEDICAL EXAMINERS lift Blade's body onto an autopsy table.  They turn on a bank of overhead UV lights.  The lead examiner reaches for a scalpel.  But as he touches the scalpel to Blade's chest -- ABIGAIL (V.0.) And Blade?  Cumberland and Hale finally got their body -- BLADE'S FACE changes.  We hear a series of POPS and CRACKS as subdermal cartilage begins to loosen and shift.  At the same time, the skin begins to lighten as melanin is gradually leached away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The virus didn't kill Blade.  But the authorities very well could have.  So in the end, realizing that own his people were doomed, Drake decided to give Blade a gift.

dialogue.raw_text: (CONT AaD) By taking Blade's shape, he bought Blade enough time to escape.  Offering Blade a second chance at life - -

direction.raw_text: A bright summer day.  Blade stands at the edge of a cliff, looking out over a sun-struck ocean.  For the first time since we've seen him, he's not wearing armor or sunglasses or handguns or rifles.  And were it not for the sword he holds, we might even mistake him for an ordinary man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blade flings his sword over the cliff, into the ocean below. ABIGAIL (V.0.) We never saw him again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.0.) And so Blade took it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see the sword sinking, reflecting the refracted sunlight from above as it twirls end over end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At peace with himself at last.  After a moment's reflection, he turns and walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A SERIES OF DISSOLVES as Blade moves further and further away from us, dwindling into the horizon until he disappears entirely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Over darkness we hear the sound of TRAFFIC.
